utterance.speaker: WIFE
utterance.content: You’ve made your point, Andy. So they closed the machine shop and turned it into a espresso bar. That doesn’t make you a bad provider. Look, this is crazy. It’s the East River. The only thing you’re going to catch out here is a cold.

utterance.speaker: WIFE
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Can you believe my old grade school shirt still fits?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Like a glove, yes. A shirt, no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You look like the Incredible Hulk.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Nice, Dad.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah, that’s what you get when you talk to him while he’s writing.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mmhmm … well, Gracie’s going to love it. It’ll crack her up when she sees it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gracie? Little cutie whose family moved to off to … I want to say Kansas?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: After fifth grade. She emailed me that she was going to town to check out FIT so I told her she could spend the night.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I asked you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was I writing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Incredible Hulk?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Gracie?

utterance.speaker: GRACIE
utterance.content: Look at you, Greendale girl.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Look at you!

utterance.speaker: GRACIE
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh, you remember Gram and my Dad.

utterance.speaker: GRACIE
utterance.content: Sure. Hey, it’s been forever.

utterance.speaker: GRACIE
utterance.content: Thanks again for letting me crash with you guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: GRACIE
utterance.content: So… your room in the same place?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. Same place. Same old room. You know, everything’s the same.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Almost.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Looks like someone’s not in Kansas any more.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened to the little hair band and knee socks?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, Beckett. Excellent timing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She used to be so adorable. What makes a girl, a little girl who used to play hopscotch and My Little Ponies, suddenly pierce her eyebrow? It’s like she’s been assimilated by the leather overlords.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re probably romanticizing it. And is anything ever really the way that we remember it in grade school?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, to be honest, beyond some baking soda volcanoes and sweaty palms, I have very little memory of it at all. You?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mine are mostly orthodontic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Braces? You mean you weren’t born with that dazzling smile?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The only thing dazzling was how long it took my parents to pay for it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Body’s in pretty good shape for a floater. Must not have been in the water too long.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Well if the river’s as cold as my nose, I’d ballpark it within the last twelve hours. At most. No ID, but he looks early forties. He’s got a Navy tattoo on his arm and a nasty crush injury along his temporal line.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any chance he went overboard?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Classic indicators point to deliberate blunt force, so I’d say no. This was no boating accident.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then we better close the beaches. No boating accident? Chief Brody? Hooper? Seriously?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’ll, uh, zip his prints over to the precinct for an ID but for what it’s worth, I did find this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A Gamblers Anonymous medallion.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Four years without a bet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ahh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ahh what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The East River? The GA chip? Relapsed gambler gets in too deep with his bookie and ends up floating in the drink.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? You just went from Gamblers Anonymous to mob hit?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is the most celebrated body depository this side of the Jersey wetlands. Mark my words. This guy has mob ties.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Case closed.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No mob ties.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good work.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: According to his fingerprints, his name is Donald Hayes. Navy veteran, served in Desert Storm, and he’s been a dock worker since ’94.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Somehow still employed as one. Our victim, Donny Hayes. Currently clocked in and on duty at the East Side docks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which either means he’s an incredibly dedicated zombie –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or he’s a suspect in our murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Donny? Mr. Hayes? Donald Hayes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s the matter? You forget your own name?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Police! Don’t move!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The man said "Don’t move."

utterance.speaker: GRANT VYRO
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Wait a minute. You guys are just cops?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just cops?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I guess that makes you just under arrest for murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: First name Grant, last name Vyro.

utterance.speaker: GRANT
utterance.content: I didn’t kill anybody.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why’d you run?

utterance.speaker: GRANT
utterance.content: I thought you was union.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so we’re not the only ones that have a problem with you killing Donny for his union card.

utterance.speaker: GRANT
utterance.content: What are you talking about? I bought that card.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you really expect us to believe that you bought Donny’s card, assumed his identity, and thought no one would notice?

utterance.speaker: GRANT
utterance.content: Guy spent sixteen years working over on the Westside. So I switched to the East Side docks so no one who knew Donny would catch on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what does a union card go for nowadays? Since buying someone else’s is illegal.

utterance.speaker: GRANT
utterance.content: Sucker cost me twenty five grand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh come on, Vyro. Dock workers rake in over six figures a year. Why would Donny trade it in for so little?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless he had a gun to his head. In which case it’d be a bargain.

utterance.speaker: GRANT
utterance.content: There were no guns. I needed a job, Donny needed cash.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: GRANT
utterance.content: He didn’t say. And I didn’t care.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I was right about the blunt force trauma. A single blow caved in the ridge here along Donny’s squamosal suture. And whatever did the damage was kind enough to leave this shard of red glass embedded in his skull.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe a heavy vase or bottle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll have forensics take a look at It, see if they can find a match.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Based on lividity and water temp, I’ve narrowed time of death to between four and six AM this morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened here, on the shoulder?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Buckshot. I found several double aught pellets lodged in the flesh of his left arm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So someone conked him on the head and shot him?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That’s where it gets weird. Scarring indicates the pellets have been there two to three weeks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And he just left them in there?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, he certainly didn’t seek treatment. It could have been that he was in something illegal or scared of whoever shot him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or both.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Forget Vyro. His alibi cleared. And we tracked down his personal check for twenty five thousand, endorsed and deposited by Donny last month.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Vyro paid Donny with a check?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not mob-y enough for you, Castle?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: CSU’s still combing Donny’s place, but no broken red glass, no signs of foul play, and no next of kin, either.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the Gamblers Anonymous chip? Any sponsor?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but he says he hasn’t heard form Donny for months.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then maybe Castle was right. If Donny was desperate enough to sell his union card then maybe he fell off the wagon and got in over his head.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, to the tune of twenty five grand.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. That’d be low-balling it, bro. Donny’s account shows that he deposited Vyro’s check, adding it to his existing balance of a hundred and twenty five thousand. All of which … wait for it … is now gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All of it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Except for the remaining balance of six dollars and twenty three cents, all a hundred and fifty K was spent in one giant check made payable to a Wilbur Pittorino, listed here as owning several properties and owns a waste management business in Garfield, New Jersey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh! Waste management.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any priors?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Back in 1977, Billy Pitt spent ten years in Federal for assault and racketeering

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Racketeering. As well as shaking down business owners where he operated his uh … bookmaking operation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: His what now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bookmaking operation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. So an ex-gambler dumps his life savings on an ex-con ex-bookmaker and ends up x’ed out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sounds like Donny was late with his hundred and fifty grand for Billy Pitt and he ended up paying for it with his life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I just said that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, you might have gotten a little greyer, Mr. Pitt, but it seems to me that you haven’t changed much at all.

utterance.speaker: BILLY PITT
utterance.content: It must be all them Pilates classes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you recognize this check?

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: Of course. It’s from Donny Hayes. So?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I’m wondering if Donny didn’t owe you more money and you didn’t flash back to your old racketeering days.

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: Cut the breaks, sweetie. Whatever the hell you dragged me down here for, I want to tell you right now that I paid my tab with Johnny Law a couple lifetimes ago and he’s got nothing on me since.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, this guy is gold.

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: If you don’t believe me, why don’t you ask … Donny. Is this about Donny?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was found dead in the East River this morning. Now back to the money. What was it for? Was it a payment or was it a gift?

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: A purchase.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For?

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: He bought my bar. Downtown. He loved the place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Enough to drop everything and dump his whole life savings into it?

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: Kid was practically raised in the joint. By his grandfather, Leo the Legend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Leo the Legend?

utterance.speaker: ROY MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You heard of the guy?

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: Said he’s best bartender since the day when ‘gay’ meant ‘happy’. He was the only father Donny knew.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where do I find Leo?

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: Resting in an old silver shaker behind the bar. Leo was kind of the bar historian and when he kicked in ’97, we figured hey, why not make him part of it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ashes behind the bar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is why Donny decided to buy the … what is it called?

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: The Old –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - Haunt.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The Old Haunt?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t tell me you’ve never been to The Old Haunt. It’s legendary. All the great writers drank there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re cops. We go to cop bars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your loss.

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: Donny was there every night anyhow. We were all the family he had.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what prompted the sudden sale? I mean, it seemed like Donny had to gather money pretty quickly.

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: The bar had been weighing down my ledger sheets for years. I had an offer from one of them TJ McChucklenuts franchises when Brian, my bartender, put together some investors and made an offer of his own. I was going to sell it to him and then Donny outbid him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how did Brian feel when Donny bought the place?

utterance.speaker: BILLY
utterance.content: He wasn’t thrilled about it, but at least he wasn’t working for TJ McChucklenuts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie just swabbed the shard of glass and found trace amounts of alcohol.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A container of alcoholic beverage, a resentful bartender –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And given the location of The Old Haunt, a potential crime scene just two blocks away from the river.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Convenient for all your body dumping needs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Castle … can I buy you a drink?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why Detective Beckett, I thought you’d never ask.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how well do you know this bar, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I haven’t been here in years. Not since Alexis. But I wrote most of my first novel in one of these booths.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. Okay. Well, that explains a lot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It sold over three million copies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I mean, why you’re so excited.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s loaded with history. First as a blacksmith, then as a bordello. It only became a bar during Prohibition as a speakeasy, and it was one of the best. I swear, you can still feel the vibration of every notorious episode of glamour and debauchery in its walls.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, easy, Castle. It’s just a bar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no. TJ McChucklenuts is just a bar. The Old Haunt is the last of a dying breed. A proud institution standing up to ruthless gentrification. It’s a classic …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What … what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I’m not going to get much out of Brian looking like a cop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Undercover. I like it. You might want to pop one more button just in case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is how a bar should smell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm, yeah. Stale beer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I would write in more bars if there were more bars like this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice to see you Eddie. It’s been a long time. Thank you for remembering.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come over here. Check out the wall of fame.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who is that handsome devil just two over from Hemingway, directly above the booth where In a Hail of Bullets was born.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my goodness, Castle, you were so cute back then.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Back then?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A lot of memories.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s old Leo which would make that young Donny. But I don’t see any red bottles.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you looking at?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: Welcome to The Old Haunt, folks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, is Donny here, by any chance?

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: Not yet, but he will be. And he won’t mind one bit that you’re sitting in his regular spot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I knew this place felt right for a reason. I’m Kate. I’m one of his old friends.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And this is Rick.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: Brian. And any old friend of Donny … is a new friend of mine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tell me, Brian. Um, you don’t by any chance carry a liqueur – it’s really delicious and it comes in this red bottle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. That red bottle we shared down in that little cantina in Tierra del Fuego.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: Red, huh? Uh, let’s see. No red here. Just your standard brown, green, and clear. Let me check the other end of the bar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you see that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How could I miss it? Can’t he see we’re together? Undercover.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. His reaction. When I mentioned Donny. I don’t think he knows.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he’s just a good liar.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: Ah, no luck. Maybe I could interest you in a blue vodka?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh no. Thank you. Way too early for vodka.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: Well, think about it, folks. I’ll be back in a second.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, Brian? We’re not really here for a drink.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: How could Donny be dead? I was just with him last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What time was that?

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: Four thirty AM. I locked up on my way out and Donny went to do the books in the office, like always.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure he was alone when you left?

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: Positive. This is just crazy. That guy was like a brother to me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Even though he bought the bar out from under you?

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: You know about that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I mean, he didn’t even offer you to be a partner. That doesn’t sound very brotherly to me.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: Hey, any beef I had with Donny was short-lived. We hashed it out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So now you’re just stealing from him.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Couldn’t help but notice your trick with the fruit, Brian. You pretend to ring up a drink, stuff the money in the till, and you keep track of it by throwing pieces of fruit into the sink. Cherries are ten, limes are what? Twenty? At nights end you tally up your fruit so you know how much to put into your tip cup before you lock the register. So what happened, Brian? Donny catch you stealing? Things get physical?

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: Over an extra thirty or forty bucks? It’s not even stealing, it’s skimming. Donny understood.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The owner understood?

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: We’d all been family long enough. Donny knew I had to get creative to make my rent once in a while.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’d like to see his office.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: Sure. It’s in the basement.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The basement?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve never seen this.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: No one knew it was there until the flood of ’98. Billy Pitt pulled up the old linoleum and there it was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A hidden basement. How cool is this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did I say cool? Make that awesome. Perfect place for a murder. No one can hear you scream.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No one can help you carry the body up the stairs, either.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe somebody marched Donny down to the river at gunpoint. Killed him there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Killer had a gun, why would he use a bottle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t ruin my story with your logic!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It smells like fresh paint.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: Donny had been putting a lot of work in to fix the place up. New brass rail, refurbished wood on the bar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You find something?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: These are buckshot holes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You own a shotgun, Brian?

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: CSU’s going to comb this place from top to bottom. Blood, buckshot, broken red glass, so if you have something to say –

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: Look, if a shotgun was fired down here everyone in the bar would know about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not if it were after hours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re talking back two or three weeks ago. Did Donny have a beef with anyone then?

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: You said two weeks ago?

utterance.speaker: ANNIE SWIFT
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. It was a couple of weeks ago. I was closing up alone. I had just done my cash drop down in the basement safe and I came up and some guy was knocking on the door. Pickup Pete.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pickup Pete? Big hit with the ladies?

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: No, he drives a pickup.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gun rack?

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: Yeah. Regular upstate redneck. Anyway, he said that he dropped his wallet in the booth, so I let him in. Next thing you know he’s got his hands all over me and he’s pushing me against the bar. All of a sudden the basement door pops open and here comes Donny like Hemingway’s ghost. Guess I missed him down there, but I’m glad he showed up when he did. He grabbed a baseball bat, chased Pete out. He smashed his tail lights, put a few dents in the pickup just for good measure before the jackass could drive off. Donny told me to go home and forget about it. He said that Pete was eighty-sixed for life. That was the last time we talked about it, until last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what happened last night?

utterance.speaker: ANNIE
utterance.content: Pete showed up again. Donny wasn’t having any of it. He just threw that trash out. Said the next time it wouldn’t be the truck he used the bat on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Donny eighty-sixed Pete for life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like Pete returned the favor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pickup Pete, aka Pete Mucha. He’s got a couple of dismissed domestic assault charges and he is also the proud owner of a Remington 870 shotgun. And Ryan and Esposito are bringing him in now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you think of ‘The Castilian’?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, The Old Haunt just reminded me of how vital tavern culture is in this town. I thought, why not open up a little tavern of my own?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So … instead of buying a drink you’re going to buy a whole bar?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My way of giving back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. To your ego.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 'The Ego'.

utterance.speaker: PETE MUCHA
utterance.content: Someone call the police!

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: Let me go! I’m fine!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pickup Pete, I take it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, we found him getting tossed out of a bar uptown.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And uh … just like the shotgun in his truck, he’s a little loaded.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe a murder charge will sober him up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yep. C’mon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 'The Castle'. It’ll have a wee drawbridge to let you in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Congratulations, Pete. You’re the drunkest murder suspect this year. And that includes St. Patrick’s Day.

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: What’d I win?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, that depends on you, Pete.

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: You know my name? And did you just say murder?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Your driver’s license says you're from up in Courtland. What, they don’t have any bars up there? Or did you get eighty-sixed from them, too?

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: The city’s where I work. You know, like drywall, like pipe setting. And I do some of my best pipe laying after work, if you know what I mean.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You own a shotgun, Pete.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You like hunting, do you?

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: Wait a minute! You after me for murdering a two point buck?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nah. We’re after you for your little dust up at The Old Haunt two weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: The Old Haunt? That’s where I was last night! Donny wouldn’t let me in because of that ***** bartender. For the record, she came on to me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Is that why you came back and killed him? Because you were drunk and angry and he wouldn’t let you in?

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: Donny’s dead?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’d you really do last night, Pete?

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: Woah! Hey! Why would I kill the guy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe because he trashed your truck.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And you were too drunk to shoot straight the last time you came after him with a shotgun.

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: Shotgun? Look, he trashed my truck, so what? He more than paid for the damages.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He what now?

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: After he pounded my truck I started calling the cops. Well he calmed down real fast and out came this fat wad and he peeled off a cool grand like it was nothing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Donny … gave you a thousand dollars?

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: He had plenty more. I asked him, ‘What’d you score, lotto?’ and he was all like ‘Yeah, sorta’. You can ask my repair guy. I paid with Donny’s cash.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Don’t go anywhere. I’m going to make a call.

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: Don’t worry. We’re going to get this guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Pete’s alibi holds. He was sleeping it off at a friend’s apartment over in Murray Hill.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s weird that a guy who only had six dollars and twenty three cents in his bank account had enough cash on hand to peel off a G like it was nothing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not to mention all the repairs he made to the bar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe he was skimming, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If he was skimming that much, there’d have to be someone he wasn’t paying. A supplier, distributor?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why don’t you guys go back to The Old Haunt and take a look at Donny’s ledgers. Let’s find out where that money was coming from.

utterance.speaker: UNIFORM
utterance.content: Here you go, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you. So CSU processed that bar and basement and there’s no indication of any broken red glass and the only blood they found was under the buckshot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So it wasn’t our murder scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It looks like Donny left that bar alive.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t get it. Donny got shot down here and he didn’t do anything wrong. Why didn’t he report it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The last thing any new bar owner wants is trouble with the cops. Even an accidental shooting on the premises could have cost Donny his liquor license for good.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s probably why he shelled out for Pete’s truck damage too.

utterance.speaker: ESPSOTIO
utterance.content: I don’t see how. His personal account isn’t the only thing that’s tapped out. The Old Haunt was barely breaking even, operating at a loss most days. There’s no way he was throwing money around.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yet he was. I’ve got invoices here, one for the new brass rail and one for the new wood for the bar, each totaling close to six grand. Both of them are stamped ‘petty cash, paid in full’.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nothing petty about that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There’s nothing in there about him winning the lotto?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Actually… maybe there is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A consignment receipt from Hagen and Graham Auction House?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why’s a guy like Donny doing business with a place that sells Picassos and Rembrandts?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: His business was barely breaking even. He was on the verge of losing everything.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And with his union card gone, it looks like he found something else to sell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but what? What does a dock worker have that’s valuable enough for a place like Hagen and Graham’s to be interested?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe something that wasn’t his.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now here’s a place that honors history and values craftsmanship.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re pretty into this whole preserving history stuff, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think just lately I’ve been noticing the changes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean in Alexis’ goth friend?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I was thinking more along the lines of Times Square. You know, once had a real New York grit and character and now they should just call it Times Square Land.

utterance.speaker: STEVEN HEISLER
utterance.content: So sorry to have kept you waiting. I’m Steven Heisler, associate curator.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m Detective Kate Beckett. This is Richard Castle. We were wondering if you recognize this man.

utterance.speaker: HEISLER
utterance.content: Oh yes, Donald Hayes. We don’t get many dock workers here, as you might imagine. What’s this about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was murdered.

utterance.speaker: HEISLER
utterance.content: Murdered? Good lord.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We understand that he put an item up here for auction. We were wondering what it was.

utterance.speaker: HEISLER
utterance.content: Are you familiar with a man by the name of Jimmy Walker?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sure, everybody knows Jimmy Walker.

utterance.speaker: HEISLER
utterance.content: No, not the actor who played JJ on Good Times.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, the former mayor of New York. Took office 1926. Went by the nickname Beau James. Famous for being a corrupt politician, renowned womanizer, and also openly defiant of Prohibition.

utterance.speaker: HEISLER
utterance.content: Ah, so you do know him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What does this former mayor have to do with this?

utterance.speaker: HEISLER
utterance.content: Donald had an item that once belonged to him. You see, Mayor Walker was rumored to have a private liquor collection thought to contain one of the finest whiskies ever distilled.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unceremoniously dumped into the sewers by Federal agents when they ran him out of office.

utterance.speaker: HEISLER
utterance.content: Donald came in with the sole surviving bottle.

utterance.speaker: HEISLER
utterance.content: An 1875 St. Miriam Rock of Scotland. I knew what it was the moment I saw the JW pressed into its wax seal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An 1875 St. Miriam. That’s the holy grail of scotches. I would kill for just a taste of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have a picture of this bottle of scotch?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where did Donny get it?

utterance.speaker: HEISLER
utterance.content: Left to him by his grandfather, Leo, who apparently was given it as a gift when he returned from World War II.

utterance.speaker: HEISLER
utterance.content: There you have it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where’s that bottle now?

utterance.speaker: HEISLER
utterance.content: It was sold for twenty six thousand dollars, to an internet millionaire named Jeffery McGuigan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A red glass bottle at twenty six grand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is one expensive murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you say this guy made his millions?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Internet gaming. Owns about fifty sites.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The guy spent twenty six K on a bottle of whisky. He could treat himself to nicer digs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s his motivation?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All I know is that this is about a body’s throw away from the river.

utterance.speaker: JEFFERY MCGUIGAN
utterance.content: Speedy Wok my ass … And you’re not even Speedy Wok.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re here about a purchase that was made at Hagen and Graham’s. Is there a Jeffery McGuigan here?

utterance.speaker: JEFFERY
utterance.content: I go by Magoo. It’s my street name, you know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously, you’re Jeffery McGuigan?

utterance.speaker: JEFFERY
utterance.content: Magoo. And yeah, I’ve purchased a ton of crap at that place. Come on in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So this piece of crap we’re looking for, Magoo, is a priceless red bottle of scotch.

utterance.speaker: JEFFERY
utterance.content: No, it had a price, all right. It was pretty tasty.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tasty? You describe a one hundred and thirty five year old bottle of scotch as … tasty?

utterance.speaker: JEFFERY
utterance.content: I mean, after I mixed in a little root beer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay Magoo, let’s see that bottle.

utterance.speaker: JEFFERY
utterance.content: Seriously? You’re just going to walk into my crib and start bossing me around?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I don’t see it here. You didn’t happen to break the bottle over …

utterance.speaker: JEFFERY
utterance.content: Now what is this about? You know, I may have dropped out of Cornell when my company went public, but I still know my rights.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That bottle that you purchased might have been used to commit murder. So unless you want to learn your Miranda rights, you better quit stalling and show us where it is.

utterance.speaker: JEFFERY
utterance.content: Yeah, okay. Cool. I’m not stalling.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: JEFFERY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were throwing it out?

utterance.speaker: JEFFERY
utterance.content: It’s in the blue bucket. I recycle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it’s still intact, unless a sliver of glass came out when it hit.

utterance.speaker: JEFFERY
utterance.content: Man, nobody hit anybody.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes well, keep mixing root beer with fine scotch and that may change.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, Castle. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cretinous little uncultured palate, doesn’t know …. did you hear what he said? Root beer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If I was fifteen years younger I would give that kid such a pinch.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Same glass. But the shard in Donny’s head is way too big to have come from this bottle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means it can’t be the only remaining bottle in the world.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Clearly not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means I still have a shot at getting a taste.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means that Donny came across a second bottle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, upside his head.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so maybe Leo gave a bottle to a relative or a friend and once Donny learned how much it was worth he went after it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And got more than he bargained for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going to do a little research on Leo. See what we can dig up on Mayor Walker and his mystery whisky.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Research. I’m going to do that too. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s called the Sidecar. One of the best drinks to come out of the Prohibition era. A time when getting a drink meant secret doors, gangsters, and bootleggers.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh Rick, I’m loving this idea. You know, our town could use a throwback joint. Ooh, perfect name for it. ‘Rick’s Café Americain’.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh Mother, that’s perfect. I was trying to come up with a Bogie reference myself. All I could think of was ‘Castleblanca’. I thought it was a little too on the nose.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I need a drink. H20. Dirty.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tap water it is.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So, where’s your dark shadow?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: She went out with some people she met at FIT. I was not invited.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know whether to be delighted or outraged.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Me neither. She’s really defensive and she makes fun of everything that’s important to me. I keep looking for the Gracie I knew but she’s just not there anymore.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, you’re not the same girl you were back then, either. You know, maybe she’s just responding to how you’ve changed.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I haven’t changed.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh darling, please. Look at you. You are tall, beautiful, sophisticated. You have a glam Gram and … him … and a boyfriend. Now did it ever occur to you that might be rather intimidating to a girl from Kansas?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Intimidating? When I asked where she got her gloves she said it was a place I wouldn’t go to.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Now, you took that as an affront and she was probably just being self-deprecating.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmhmm. You know what, I think someone needs a virgin Mojito. Go grab me some more mint. It’s in the fridge.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Here’s looking at you, kid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Woah! You could have told me you booby-trapped it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Yes, that’s just how I protect my stash from G-men and mobsters.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mmm. At least help me reload them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. Reload. Reload. Beckett? I think I know how Donny was shot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Take a trip with me, to a simple yet dangerous time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, CSU already swept through this entire basement. And we were just tucked in with my laptop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Josh and I. He was helping me research.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anyway. A dangerous time when Prohibition was law and bootleggers, the lawless, often going to extreme measures to protect their liquid treasure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you get to the point?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Do you remember when Donny jumped up and rescued Annie from Pickup Pete? She said she completely missed him when she was down here doing her safe drop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was late. She was tired. I can relate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe he wasn’t down here at all. Buckshot wall. Wall directly opposite. Help me move the shelf.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what exactly are we hoping to find?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The truth. Same thing Donny was hoping for. In all the stories that Leo told as bar historian, what if he saved one story, just for Donny. A story that Leo himself could never verify because the trap door to the basement wasn’t discovered until after he died. When Billy Pitt decided to sell the bar and TJ McChucklenuts was going to buy it, Donny realized he had to find out before it was too late.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Find … what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Donny sold his union card and bet his life savings that Beau James … come Help me. There we go. That Beau James’ secret stash really existed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you pushing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I am pushing!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay … that’s … wow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh Castle. This is where Donny was when Annie made the drop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh ho… Donny pulled on this door and blam said the lady.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you hear that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rushing water.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If that water leads to the East River then that’s probably where Donny was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re going to need a light, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not so fast, Indy. We’re also going to need breathable air. So…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A torch would be more fun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This must be part of the old sewer system.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Probably used these as access tunnels during Prohibition. It’s incredible, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Aside from the fact that it’s … damp, cramped, dark, and we are almost certainly walking in rat poop … awesome.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t look at the C.H.U.D.s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C.H.U.D.s?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cannibalistic Humanoid Underground Dwellers. These sewers are crawling with them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I kind of figured you more for an alligator in the sewer type of guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s alligators down here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Woah. It looks like an old passageway that was bricked up a long time ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, until Donny got at it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Woah ho ho …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mayor Walker’s moniker. 1929. That’s when Prohibition started.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Best time capsule ever. Imagine Donny’s joy when he realized Leo’s legends were true. Twenty six thousand dollars a bottle, who cares that Brian was skimming?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s gotta be a hundred bottles of scotch on these walls.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Take one down and pass it around …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey! That’s evidence. There’s already a lot that’s been taken.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fairly recently, too. These bottles are caked with dust and the empty spaces are relatively clean.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here’s our murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hopefully with some prints on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s probably blood mixed in there, too. In case you were thinking of tasting it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh c’mon. I’m not that desperate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm. So someone else finds out about Donny’s treasure, follows him down here, surprises him, a fight breaks out, and the killer grabs the only weapon available.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Striking the fatal blow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And it looks like the killer dragged the body right back out the same way. Look at this, all the way down. He travels all the way …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, this tunnel has everything. Secret scotch vault, private murder nook, convenient sewer disposal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I bet you this water leads straight to the East River.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is still fairly bright. Someone’s been here in the past two hours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Police! Don’t move!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stop! NYPD! This way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where did he go?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was right in front of us. I heard him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is a dead end. He couldn’t have gotten past us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s no other way he could have gotten out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how did he get away?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: What do you mean gone?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was right there in front of us then … nothing but a brick wall.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: And there’s no way this guy could have gotten past you two and snuck out of The Old Haunt?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it was too narrow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Brian the bartender and a handful of regulars were still upstairs. They swear. No one came out before we did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We think that our spirit-loving Mayor didn’t want to be seen going back and forth from his favorite speakeasy so he had a back way entrance built to his stash.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hidden from view. And trust me, we looked.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. I just got off the phone with Lanie. She confirms the blood on the broken bottle is Donny’s. It’s definitely our murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But we’ve run the prints and we still came up empty. No matches to anyone at The Old Haunt or in our system.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: It took seventy years to find a way down to those tunnels from The Old Haunt and somehow our killer finds another way in? How?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s gotta be another access point from the tunnel to the East River sewer line. The Sewer Bureau’s map doesn’t have anything. It’s like CONA doesn’t even know those tunnels exist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s because these are modern sewer lines. Any of the old sewer lines that didn’t get patched in when the new ones were built? They just got bricked up and abandoned.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: It’s like the old subway lines. There are whole stations underground that no one’s seen in decades.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So basically we need to take a look at an old sewer map and once we figured out where our killer disappeared to … we might be able to find some witnesses on the other end.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Then let’s find that map.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This place could use a little gentrification. Or at least a copy machine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s the pre-World War II archives section, Castle. Half of this probably hasn’t been seen in over seventy years. Lower East Side, 1920. That’s about when Prohibition was getting started.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, you see how much nicer the neighborhood was back then?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You think that little box there might be The Old Haunt?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. That’s where it would be. Not long after its bordello phase. I can still see the little garter belts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, there’s a sewer line running under it that wasn’t on the newer map. So that’s gotta be our tunnel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which would put Walker’s whiskey right about here. A man could grab himself a bottle, come and go without ever being seen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But come and go from where. Where did he start from?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here’s where our tunnel ends and our killer vanished. There’s one, two, three sewer lines that branch off from that point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any of which our killer could have accessed to get away from us. So if we can figure out exactly where the three sewers end we can subpoena traffic cams around the time the killer got away. Maybe get an ID.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or maybe we won’t need any of that. You said that no one has laid eyes on these maps in over seventy years only it says here, someone checked this one out just two weeks ago. And I’ll bet a bottle of Beau James' whisky that someone was trying to make their way back to the Mayor’s stash just like we are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Going once, going twice …

utterance.speaker: HEISLER
utterance.content: Sold! To the gentleman in the back.

utterance.speaker: HEISLER
utterance.content: Next up, we have a marvelous 1955 Chateau Restivo Blanc. And we’ll start the bidding at twelve hundred dollars. Do I hear twelve hundred? There’s twelve hundred. Do I hear twelve fifty? Twelve fifty there. Thirteen hundred? Thirt –

utterance.speaker: HEISLER
utterance.content: Thirteen hundred in the back. Do I hear thirteen fifty? Thirteen hundred and fifty dol –

utterance.speaker: HEISLER
utterance.content: Thirteen hundred and fifty …

utterance.speaker: HEISLER
utterance.content: Do I hear… fourteen?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s just a sad case of Donny trusting the wrong guy. He told Heisler about the Beau James stash and Heisler got greedy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He convinced Donny that the whisky would fetch a better price if he sold it a bottle at a time. So Donny left the stash where he found it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that gave Heisler enough time to figure out where it was hidden. When Donny caught him in the vault, Heisler panicked, hit him with a bottle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. We figured out how Heisler disappeared on you in the tunnels.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Secret passageway!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Basically. He had a hidden entrance that could only be opened from the other side. CSU followed it from the street to the abandoned sewer to the tunnel, just like Mayor Walker had drawn it up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Here’s three cases Heisler hadn’t gotten around to selling yet.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: At twenty six Gs a pop, you’re looking at just under a cool million.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh… how might I acquire one of these for myself?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I told you. They’re evidence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but who’s to say that today’s evidence can’t be tomorrow’s nightcap?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: That would be me. Now, I’m sure it will be a few months before we can figure out to whom this and the rest of the stuff belongs.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Montgomery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look at you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Isn't it cool? Gracie took me shopping at this place I never even knew existed. It’s right down the street from here. They had the greatest stuff. She has a really good eye.

utterance.speaker: GRACIE
utterance.content: Well, Alexis looks good in everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m glad you two reconnected.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We just … had to get to know the new us’es. Neither of us are ten anymore.

utterance.speaker: GRACIE
utterance.content: Thanks for letting me crash at Chez Castle. It reminded me of the good old days. Before life got too real, you know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I do know.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m going to walk her to the train.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Gram’s waiting downstairs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks for the warning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. I remember that phase. It’s about when I got my tattoo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’ve … got a tattoo?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Just heard from the DA, Castle. Apparently because all of these bottles used to belong to Beau James and he used to be our mayor, it’s her opinion that they’re owned by the city. But, she says if you’re willing to make a generous donation to the NYPD Widows and Orphans fund, you can have one of Beau James’ best for your very own. This is early Christmas, baby.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can … I was not expecting this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you crying?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. I don’t know what to say.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Try ‘let me get my checkbook’.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, of course. Of course. But I will only accept this if you will share it with me.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Twist my arm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Not here. Um, at The Old Haunt. We will toast to Donny, with his family.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, what about that place? What happens to The Old Haunt?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s going to go back to the bank. Which means that TJ McChucklenuts is going to get another shot at it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I wouldn’t worry about The Old Haunt.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You bought it, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, you joining us?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I’d love to. It’s late and I’ve got a lot of paperwork …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s nine o’clock on a Saturday.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s nine fifteen, actually.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The regular crowd shuffles in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There’s an old man sitting next to me.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY_ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Making love to his tonic and gin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He said, "Son, can you play me a memory / I’m not really sure how it goes."

utterance.speaker: CASTLE_BECKETT
utterance.content: "But it’s sad and it’s sweet and I knew it complete, when I wore a younger man’s clothes."

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
